{
  "file": "Login.aspx.cs",
  "vulnerabilities": [
    {
      "title": "Insecure JWT Handling",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-352",
      "description": "The JWT is generated and stored in a cookie without proper validation of the user's role or permissions, which could lead to privilege escalation if the JWT is compromised.",
      "line_numbers": [36, 37],
      "recommendation": "Ensure that the JWT is signed and validated properly. Implement role-based access control to restrict actions based on user roles."
    },
    {
      "title": "Potential Information Disclosure",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-209",
      "description": "The application provides a generic error message for invalid credentials, which could allow an attacker to enumerate valid usernames.",
      "line_numbers": [24, 45],
      "recommendation": "Implement more generic error messages that do not disclose whether the username or password was incorrect."
    },
    {
      "title": "Session Fixation Vulnerability",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-384",
      "description": "The application does not invalidate the session after successful authentication, which could allow an attacker to hijack a session.",
      "line_numbers": [30, 31],
      "recommendation": "Invalidate the previous session and create a new session upon successful login to prevent session fixation attacks."
    },
    {
      "title": "Lack of Input Validation",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-20",
      "description": "User input for email and password is not properly validated or sanitized, which could lead to injection attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [12, 13],
      "recommendation": "Implement input validation and sanitization for user inputs to prevent injection attacks."
    }
  ]
}
